item.title: ALPHV/BlackCat Take Extortion Public

item.title: A Closer Look at ChatGPT's Role in Automated Malware Creation

category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Threat Actors Leverage File-Sharing Service and Reverse Proxies for Credential Harvesting
item.description: We analyzed a phishing campaign involving malicious emails containing a link to a file-sharing solution, which further leads to a PDF document with a secondary link designed to steal login info and session cookies.

Trent Bessell

item.title: How Kopeechka, an Automated Social Media Accounts Creation Service, Can Facilitate Cybercrime

item.title: Attacks on 5G Infrastructure From User Devices: ASN.1 Vulnerabilities in 5G Cores
item.description: In the second part of this series, we will examine how attackers can trigger vulnerabilities by sending control messages masquerading as user traffic to cross over from user plane to control plane.

item.title: Beware: Lumma Stealer Distributed via Discord CDN

item.title: Void Rabisu Targets Female Political Leaders with New Slimmed-Down ROMCOM Variant
item.description: Almost a year after Void Rabisu shifted its targeting from opportunistic ransomware attacks with an emphasis on cyberespionage, the threat actor is still developing its main malware, the ROMCOM backdoor.

Fernando Merces
category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks

item.title: DarkGate Opens Organizations for Attack via Skype, Teams
item.description: We detail an ongoing campaign abusing messaging platforms Skype and Teams to distribute the DarkGate malware to targeted organizations. We also discovered that once DarkGate is installed on the victim’s system, additional payloads were introduced to the environment.

Ryan Maglaque
Aira Marcelo
Jack Walsh
David Walsh
category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks

item.title: Electric Power System Cybersecurity Vulnerabilities
item.description: Digitalization has changed the business environment of the electric power industry, exposing it to various threats. This webinar will help you uncover previously unnoticed threats and develop countermeasures and solutions.
item.dc:creator: Mayumi Nishimura

item.title: Exposing Infection Techniques Across Supply Chains and Codebases
item.description: This entry delves into threat actors' intricate methods to implant malicious payloads within seemingly legitimate applications and codebases.

category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: APT34 Deploys Phishing Attack With New Malware
item.description: We observed and tracked the advanced persistent threat (APT) APT34 group with a new malware variant accompanying a phishing attack comparatively similar to the SideTwist backdoor malware. Following the campaign, the group abused a fake license registration form of an African government agency to target a victim in Saudi Arabia.

Mahmoud Zohdy
category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks

item.title: Examining the Activities of the Turla APT Group

category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks

item.title: Decoding Turla: Trend Micro's MITRE Performance
item.description: This year, the MITRE Engenuity ATT&CK evaluation tested cybersecurity vendors against simulated attack scenarios mimicking the adversary group “Turla.” Learn about Trend Micro's 100% successful protection performance.
item.dc:creator: Shannon Murphy
category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Cybercriminals Exploit the Moroccan Tragedy in New Scam Campaign
item.description: This blog entry details a scheme that exploits the recent Morocco earthquake by impersonating the domain name of a well-known humanitarian organization for financial fraud.
item.dc:creator: Cedric Pernet
category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Attacks on 5G Infrastructure From Users’ Devices
item.description: Crafted packets from cellular devices such as mobile phones can exploit faulty state machines in the 5G core to attack cellular infrastructure. Smart devices that critical industries such as defense, utilities, and the medical sectors use for their daily operations depend on the speed, efficiency, and productivity brought by 5G. This entry describes CVE-2021-45462 as a potential use case to deploy a denial-of-service (DoS) attack to private 5G networks.
item.dc:creator: Salim S.I.
category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Lusca Employs New Linux Backdoor, Uses Cobalt Strike for Lateral Movement
item.description: While monitoring Earth Lusca, we discovered an intriguing, encrypted file on the threat actor's server — a Linux-based malware, which appears to originate from the open-source Windows backdoor Trochilus, which we've dubbed SprySOCKS due to its swift behavior and SOCKS implementation.

Jaromir Horejsi
category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks

item.title: Analyzing a Facebook Profile Stealer Written in Node.js
item.description: We analyze an information stealer written in Node.js, packaged into an executable, exfiltrated stolen data via both Telegram bot API and a C&C server, and employed GraphQL as a channel for C&C communication.

item.description: We break down a new cyberespionage campaign deployed by a cybercriminal group we named Earth Estries. item.description: Since its initial release in late 2022, the AI-powered text generation tool known as ChatGPT has been experiencing rapid adoption rates from both organizations and individual users. However, its latest feature, known as Shared Links, comes with the potential risk of unintentional disclosure of confidential information.
item.dc:creator: Matsukawa Bakuei

item.title: Malvertising Used as Entry Vector for BlackCat, Actors Also Leverage SpyBoy Terminator
item.description: We found that malicious actors used malvertising to distribute malware via cloned webpages of legitimate organizations. The distribution involved a webpage of the well-known application WinSCP, an open-source Windows application for file transfer. We were able to identify that this activity led to a BlackCat (aka ALPHV) infection, and actors also used SpyBoy, a terminator that tampers with protection provided by agents.
dc:creator: Lucas Silva
RonJay Caragay
Arianne Dela Cruz
Gabriel Cardoso

item.title: An Overview of the Different Versions of the Trigona Ransomware
item.description: The Trigona ransomware is a relatively new ransomware family that began activities around late October 2022 — although samples of it existed as early as June 2022. item.description: We observed the threat actor group known as “8220 Gang” employing new strategies for their respective campaigns, including exploits for the Linux utility “lwp-download” and CVE-2017-3506, an Oracle WebLogic vulnerability.
item.dc:creator: Sunil Bharti
category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Water Orthrus's New Campaigns Deliver Rootkit and Phishing Modules
item.description: Water Orthrus has been active recently with two new campaigns. CopperStealth uses a rootkit to install malware on infected systems, while CopperPhish steals credit card information. This blog will provide the structure of the campaign and how they work.
dc:creator: Jaromir Horejsi
Joseph C Chen
category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Malicious AI Tool Ads Used to Deliver Redline Stealer
item.description: We’ve been observing malicious advertisement campaigns in Google’s search engine with themes that are related to AI tools such as Midjourney and ChatGPT.
item.dc:creator: Junestherry Dela Cruz
category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Energy Transformation via Cyber-Resilient Smart Grid
item.description: Learn more about smart grid vulnerabilities and how organizations can future-proof their enterprises.

item.description: Trend’s diversification of business units and geographic markets provides resilience that enables growth, anticipation and innovation.

item.title: Managed XDR Investigation of Ducktail in Trend Vision One™
item.description: The Trend Micro Managed XDR team investigated several Ducktail-related web browser credential dumping incidents involving different customers.

item.title: Attack on Security Titans: Earth Longzhi Returns With New Tricks
item.description: After months of dormancy, Earth Longzhi, a subgroup of advanced persistent threat (APT) group APT41, has reemerged using new techniques in its infection routine. This blog entry forewarns readers of Earth Longzhi’s resilience as a noteworthy threat.
dc:creator: Ted Lee
Hara Hiroaki
category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Rapture, a Ransomware Family With Similarities to Paradise
item.description: In March and April 2023, we observed a type of ransomware targeting its victims via a minimalistic approach with tools that leave only a minimal footprint behind. Our findings revealed many of the preparations made by the perpetrators and how quickly they managed to carry out the ransomware attack.
dc:creator: Don Ovid Ladores
Ian Kenefick
Earle Maui Earnshaw
category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Attackers Use Containers for Profit via TrafficStealer
item.description: We found TrafficStealer abusing open container APIs in order to redirect traffic to specific websites and manipulate engagement with ads.
item.dc:creator: Alfredo Oliveira
category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Update Now: PaperCut Vulnerability CVE-2023-27350 Under Active Exploitation
item.description: Two  vulnerabilities in PaperCut have been found, and one of them is being actively exploited in the wild. This blog entry provides a summary of the vulnerabilities, and includes security guidance for IT and SOC professionals.
category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports
